visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a stacked area chart. The chart should have a title 'Greenhouse gases from Norwegian economic activity' and a subtitle with a source link. The y-axis should display 'Million tonnes CO<sub>2</sub>-equivalents'. The chart should include five data series: 'Ocean transport', 'Households', 'Agriculture and hunting', 'Air transport', and 'Construction'. Each series should start from the year 2012. The chart should have a normal stacking, with a line color of #666666 and a line width of 1. The marker should also have a line width of 1 and a line color of #666666. The tooltip should be shared and formatted with a header. The chart should be styled with specific colors and font sizes for labels, axes, and titles.

title.text: Greenhouse gases from Norwegian economic activity

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a stacked area chart. The chart type is set to 'area', and it includes a title and subtitle aligned to the left. The y-axis title uses HTML to display 'Million tonnes CO<sub>2</sub>-equivalents'. The tooltip is shared and formatted with a header. The plot options specify that the series should start from the year 2012, with normal stacking, a line color of #666666, and a line width of 1. The marker also has a line width of 1 and a line color of #666666. The data series include five categories: 'Ocean transport', 'Households', 'Agriculture and hunting', 'Air transport', and 'Construction', each with corresponding data points.
